fields.venue_general_rule: Camera Policy: Personal cameras are allowed in the venue. Flash photography, video and removable lens cameras are not permitted without venue approval.

fields.venue_parking_detail: Park under The TD Garden in the new garage or in one of the several lots around the building.
fields.venue_general_rule: Alcohol Policy : To purchase alcoholic beverages, a patron must present a valid MA driver's license, MA liquor ID, passport or military ID, which indicates the patron to be a least 21 years of age (MA ID cards, duplicate licenses, expired licenses, damaged licenses and driver's licenses, which do not have photos, will not be accepted). Out of state licenses are acceptable only if the patron is at least 25 years of age and another form of identification (e.g., credit card) will be required if the patron is between 25 and 30 years of age. For out of country patrons, only a valid Passport will be accepted as proof of identification. No smoking is allowed in the building.

ALL TIMES LISTED ARE DOOR TIMES AND NOT SHOW TIMES. All sales are final. No refunds or exchanges. All bags larger than 10 x 9 inches, backpacks, luggage (include video and camera) are strictly prohibited. Smoking and Vaping are also strictly prohibited in the venue. No lighters, outside food, beverage bottles or cans. Other items that are prohibited: weapons, knives, drug paraphernalia, liquid containers, laser pointers, any LED apparel, masks, glow sticks, toys, candy or beaded jewelry, selfie sticks, laptops, tablets, any gang affiliated apparel etc etc. All patrons will be subject to a search before entering the venue. All medications must be presented with a proof of prescription. Personal cameras are allowed in the venue, although any flash photography, removable camera lens or video equipment are not allowed without approval from the venue.

fields.venue_parking_detail: Parking is available for Leader Bank Pavilion patrons at the Seaport Hotel Garage and the EDIC Garage; both are within a short walk of the Pavilion. The Seaport Hotel Garage can be accessed from Seaport Boulevard. The Seaport Boulevard entrance is at the intersection of Seaport Boulevard and B Street, three blocks before the Leader Bank Pavilion. The EDIC garage is on Northern Avenue. Follow Northern Avenue past the Leader Bank Pavilion, straight around the rotary and it will be ahead on the right.
fields.venue_accessible_seating: Accessible Seating Accessible seating is available for patrons in wheelchairs or with impaired mobility. They may be purchased at the Box Office, at Ticketmaster retail locations, Ticketmaster on-line, and Ticketmaster via phone.
fields.venue_general_rule: Rules and Restrictions: All events take place rain or shine. No refunds or exchanges. No lawn chairs. No food or beverages (except factory-sealed bottles of water). There is NO SMOKING allowed anywhere at the venue. No Re-Admission Ticket limit of 8 per purchase is standard (with some exceptions). Backpacks and Large Bags: Rockland Trust Bank Pavilion strongly discourages customers from bringing backpacks and large bags (over 1 gallon size) to the Pavilion. All backpacks and large bags will be subject to a thorough inspection at a designated entry gate and may delay your entry into the Pavilion. Camera Policy: Personal, non-professional cameras are allowed in the venue unless they are prohibited by the artist. Flash photography, video and removable lens cameras are not permitted without venue approval. Group Sales: No group discounts. Functions may be booked through the venue administration office. Weapons Prohibited: Guests, including law enforcement personnel not present in an official capacity, are prohibited from bringing weapons into the venue. Rockland Trust Bank Pavilion does not provide weapon lockers. Weapons may not be checked in at the Guest Services kiosk. Weapons include, but are not limited to, the following: firearms, explosives, stun guns, handcuffs, brass knuckles, sticks, clubs, batons, martial arts instruments, pepper spray, tear gas, and knives with blades over 2 inches in length. Guests found in possession of the above-mentioned items will be asked to remove the item from the venue or dispose of it. Guests who refuse to comply will be evicted from the venue.

fields.venue_parking_detail: Premier Parking is available for purchase in advance or on the day of the show (subject to availability) for most events. The Premier Parking lot is located at the main entrance to the venue at 61 Savitt Way. A Premier Parking hang tag is required for entry to the Premier Parking lot. Hang tags are available for purchase in advance or on the day of the show (subject to availability) for most events. Oversized vehicle parking is extremely limited and is sold first come first served and normally sells out on each event. Purchase in advance by adding Premier Parking to your ticket purchase when buying on LiveNation.com. Hang tags will be mailed by the venue no later than 10 days prior to the event. Premier Parking may also be purchased in advance at the Toyota Presents Oakdale Theatre Box Office in Wallingford, CT. Day of show purchases can be made at the entrance to the Premier lot - subject to availability. Rates vary according to the event and type of vehicle. Cash or credit card is accepted. ADA Accessible parking is located within the Premier Parking lot adjacent to the main gates. In an effort to provide ADA Accessible parking to our guests who need it, we require guests to display a valid ADA Accessible hangtag or license plate. ADA parking is available on a first come first served basis.
fields.venue_accessible_seating: Seating for the disabled is available throughout the facility including lawn area. All wheelchair locations can be accessed via ramps. Adjacent companion seating is available subject to availability.
fields.venue_general_rule: ALL EVENTS ARE RAIN OR SHINE. There are no cancellations or refunds due to inclement weather. Re-entry to the facility is not permitted. The XFINITY Theatre is a non-smoking facility. Smoking is prohibited in the pavilion and all covered areas. All patrons are subject to search prior to entering the facility gates including the use of metal detectors. Patrons are permitted to bring outside food into the venue. Food must be in a gallon size plastic bag. Patrons are allowed to bring in one factory sealed bottle of water, up to one liter in volume (subject to artist approval). The following items are NOT permitted - Alcohol, drugs, fireworks, weapons of any type, signs or banners, coolers, glass containers, laser pointers, selfie sticks, animals (with the exception of service dogs), or backpacks. Camera Policy: Personal cameras are allowed in the venue. Flash photography, video and removable lens cameras are not permitted without venue approval. Selfie sticks are not permitted in the venue. The following items MAY BE prohibited depending on the event, expected attendance or artist request: Small lawn chairs not exceeding 9" in height, blankets and umbrellas. When umbrellas are permitted they cannot be pointed. Specially designed lawn chairs are available for rent for a nominal fee.

fields.venue_parking_detail: The Wilbur Theatre will validate customer parking at the 660 Washington St. Garage when you enter after 5:00 pm and exit before 5:00 am weekdays and all day Saturdays and Sundays. To receive the discount be sure to take your ticket with you and show it to any house employee for a chaser ticket as you exit the theater. The vehicle entrance to the garage is located at 660 Washington Street. Pedestrian access and the Cashier Station | Parking Office are located to the left of the garage entrance. You can now pay for discounted parking in advance right here: http://www.parkwhiz.com/the-wilbur-theatre-parking. Reserving your parking in advance is the suggested method to confirm discounted parking.
fields.venue_accessible_seating: Accessible seating policy: The Wilbur Theatre is committed to accommodating patrons requiring accessible seating. Accessible seats will be held until all other seats are sold out. After which, accessible seats will become available to the general public. Please call us at 617-248-9700 for any special requests and we will do our best to help in any way we can. PLEASE NOTE: There is no elevator up to the mezzanine and balcony levels.
fields.venue_general_rule: Items NOT allowed: NO weapons or firearms, NO cameras, NO recording devices, NO outside food or beverages, NO umbrellas All bags/purses are subject to search upon entry Smoking is NOT permitted. The venue does not permit re-entry. The use of cell phones is strictly prohibited during performances.

fields.venue_parking_detail: Event parking is available for a fee in the lot adjacent to the venue as well as the Salisbury Beach Municipal Parking lot within walking distance.
fields.venue_general_rule: Cameras are allowed, however flash photography and videotaping is not permitted. Outside food and beverage, backpacks, knives or weapons are also not permitted. Patrons are subject to bag and pat down search. Blue Ocean Music Hall is a non-smoking facility. Smoking is allowed before and after performances in the secured outside smoking area.

fields.venue_parking_detail: Parking is located on site for free.
fields.venue_general_rule: *ITEMS -NOT- ALLOWED IN FACILITY : NO Weapons NO Illegal drugs or contra ban, Outside Food, Bottles, Backpacks, Costumes or masks. * ITEMS ALLOWED IN FACILITY : Non-professional Cameras * SMOKING POLICY : NO Smoking

fields.venue_accessible_seating: For TTY service call: 1.800.843.4327 or 1.800.359.2525. All gates around Fenway Park are handicap-accessible; however, only Gate D has an elevator available. Grandstand wheelchair ticket holders should enter through Gate D.
fields.venue_general_rule: In a continuing effort to provide comprehensive and thorough security, fans are encouraged to arrive as early as possible. Fans may not bring backpacks, coolers, computers, briefcases, containers, or bags of any type into Fenway Park. Fans traveling directly from work are reminded to leave the items listed above at their place of business. Small purses and diaper bags are allowed but will be subject to inspection. (Diaper bags are permissable only when the bearer accompanied by an infant or child of appropriate age.) Fans will NOT be permitted to store any of the prohibited items at Fenway Park.

fields.venue_name: Premier Theater at Foxwoods Resort Casino
fields.venue_general_rule: Items NOT allowed : No Signs smoking is NOT permitted

fields.venue_parking_detail: From Route 93 (North or South): Medford Square is easily accessed from Route 93. Take Exit 32 for Rt. 60 West. At the rotary, follow the parking attendant who will direct you to the suggested parking behind Medford City Hall. From Route 2 (East or West): From Route 2 take Exit 59 and follow the signs for Route 60 East. Stay on Route 60 East through Arlington, and into Medford. Route 60 goes right into Medford Square. When you get to the main intersection in the middle of the square take Riverside Drive to City Hall Mall where you will find the suggested parking behind Medford City Hall. There is also plenty of on street paring (Free after 6pm) and municipal parking lots within a few blocks of the theatre.
fields.venue_accessible_seating: Accessible seating policy: The Chevalier Theatre places high priority on the comfort and safety of its patrons. The Chevalier Theatre also recognizes the needs of people with disabilities, as defined by the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) of 1990. Every effort has been made to comply with both ADA and Commonwealth accessibility guidelines to accommodate patrons with disabilities. Accessible seating can be purchased directly via www.ticketmaster.com. Accessible seats will be marked with an ADA icon. For assistance purchasing ADA seats online, please contact Ticketmaster customer service at 800-653-8000. PLEASE NOTE: When a show is over 85% sold any unsold accessible seating will be opened to the general public.
fields.venue_general_rule: Items NOT allowed: NO weapons or firearms, NO cameras, NO recording devices, NO outside food or beverages, NO umbrellas All bags/purses are subject to search upon entry Smoking is NOT permitted. The venue does not permit re-entry. The use of cell phones is strictly prohibited during performances.

fields.venue_parking_detail: The closest parking lot is on Tremont Street.
fields.venue_accessible_seating: Accessible seats can be purchased by via the phone, Internet, or at any Ticketmaster Retail Location. One companion per wheelchair. There are also seats available for sight impaired patrons. One companion per patron.

fields.venue_parking_detail: Ample (2,300 spaces), safe (24 hour security patrolled), convenient (immediately adjacent to the Dunkin' Donuts Center), and professional (uniformed, trained personnel) parking available at the two Rhode Island Convention Center parking garages. Both garages are located immediately adjacent to the Dunkin' Donuts Center, one at 99 West Exchange Street (also adjacent to the Westin Hotel) and the other at 7 Service Road (directly across Service Road from the Dunkin' Donuts Center main entrance).
fields.venue_accessible_seating: This venue is equipped for accessible patrons.
fields.venue_general_rule: No cameras, video devices, or bottles are allowed per promoter requests.

fields.venue_parking_detail: There are several parking options within a short distance of the Lynn Memorial Auditorium. For a map of area parking facilities, please visit http://lynnauditorium.com/directions.html
fields.venue_accessible_seating: For accessible seating info, contact the box office at (781) 599-SHOW (7469).
fields.venue_general_rule: Items -Not- Allowed In Facility : NO cameras NO recording NO outside food or beverages. Backpacks and large bags must be checked. All bags are subject to search. Smoking is NOT permitted. Cell phone use, including recording shows is prohibited.

fields.venue_parking_detail: Metered and unmetered parking is available on Cabot Street and side streets. There are municipal parking lots on Pond Street, one block away, and in other locations including at Beverly Depot, 10 Park Street.

fields.venue_name: Virtual Event - US East Coast - EST

fields.venue_parking_detail: We provide ample parking for the events right on the property. A parking pass is required of every vehicle looking to enter the property for the events. There are several different kinds of parking passes including overnight tent site parking passes. Please see the different parking options below. Our parking areas typically open 3 to 4 hours before the show starts. Please review the times on our website as they can change and the time on your tickets and/or passes may no longer be accurate. $65 Ultimate Bath VIP Parking (East) $55 Ultimate Bath VIP Parking (West) $40 Kubota Prime Tailgate Parking $30 MB Tractor Premium Parking $15 Orange Standard Parking $75 Limo/RV Parking $65 Kittery Trading Post Overnight Tent Sites
fields.venue_accessible_seating: ADA tickets can be purchased online via www.livenation.com. You do not need to call the box office to place an order as all of our accessible tickets are available through www.livenation.com. Look for the logo on the Find Tickets page to view all available accessible seats. We do have accessible seating in every price range, but be advised it does occasionally sell out. We have very limited seating available for guests on the day of the event so please make sure you purchase accessible seating when you order tickets.
fields.venue_general_rule: What is Allowed in the Gates? The following is a list of items and whether they are typically allowed into the venue or not. Sometimes a specific tour may require a different policy on certain items. All items that are allowed in are subject to a thorough search from our security team. »Bags or Purses? No, except for a small clutch purse or a clear tote with a maximum size of 12" Wide x 12" High x 6" Deep. »Lawn Chairs? Chair rentals are available for $5! Pick them up when you arrive and then leave them where they are when you leave. Fast, simple and hassle-free! (If you wish to bring your own lawn chair, please be aware that they MUST adhere to the size limitation policy and you will have a thorough search at a specific location that will make entry in the venue slower.) »Blankets? If you have a lawn seating ticket, yes. »Food & Drink? No, except for one factory-sealed bottle of water, 20 oz. or less, per person »Refillable Water Bottles? Yes, but only completely empty. There are fill stations inside. »Coolers? No. »Weapons? No. »Cameras? Yes but only non-professional without a detachable lens. »IPads? No. »Video Camera? No. »Selfie Sticks? No. »Drugs? No. »Medications? Yes, but only in the original prescription container with matching ID. »Pets? No. »Poster Tubes? Yes. »Umbrellas? Yes, but may not be open during the performance. We recommend quality rain gear. »Signs? Yes, but please be courteous to others. Lawn Seating The lawn seating is a general admission area behind the reserved pavilion seats. It is not covered and therefore, is exposed to the elements. In the event of inclement weather, we recommend quality rain gear. Umbrellas are allowed but may not be open during the performances. Smoking is prohibited except in one section to the far right of the lawn. If you have trouble walking up inclined surfaces, lawn seating may not be the best option for you. If lawn seating is your only option, please see our staff for assistance. Traffic Please plan ahead and allow for plenty of extra time in the event of heavy traffic so that you do not miss any of the earlier performances. We open the parking lots hours early to accommodate all those that want to arrive early. Drop-Offs & Pick-Ups Please arrive before the rush on both ends of a pick-up and drop-off and do so at the Main Entrance off of Route 11B in Gilford -- 72 Meadowbrook Ln. Tailgating We have several parking areas and we condone and even, promote, responsible tailgating. Tailgating can be a very big part of making the event fun and memorable for you. That being said, the possession or consumption of alcoholic beverages, in our parking areas, actually violates a local Gilford ordinance. Underage drinking and/or intoxication, will most certainly cause you to miss the show and may lead to being arrested. Weather All performances will go on rain or shine. In the event of a weather emergency, like a hurricane, events will most likely be rescheduled. In the event of inclement weather, please use quality rain gear. Umbrellas are allowed but may not be open during performances. Umbrellas Umbrellas are allowed inside the venue and we allow all types of chairs and blankets in the lawn area. We ask that you are courteous and keep your umbrella closed during the performance to not obstruct anyone's view. We recommend wearing ponchos or other rain gear. The show will go on rain or shine. Weapons There are absolutely no weapons of any kind permitted into the venue including small pocket knives. There will be bag searches and pat downs. Any weapons discovered on an individual attempting to enter the venue will be confiscated and we will not be able to return that item to you at any time. Pets There are no pets allowed anywhere on the property. Please contact the box office in advance to coordinate the use of any kind of service animal. No Re-entry Once you enter the pavilion, you will not be permitted to leave the venue and re-enter again so please be sure to bring everything you need with you the first time. Be sure to have your photo ID with you as everyone is carded for alcohol service. Doors The doors or gates to our midway typically open between 90 and 120 minutes prior to the main stage performances starting. We usually have a lot going on include excellent regional acts playing on the Magic Hat Stage so please come in early, enjoy everything we have to offer and assure your party not missing any of the show all at the same time. Resale Tickets When the artist approves to do so, we offer our customers the ability to buy and sell tickets directly from each other for their convenience, comfort and security. For more information on our resell program, go here. Ticket Information There are no refunds or exchanges on any tickets for any event. GROUP SALES Contact Aubrey at AubreyBrooks@LiveNation.com

fields.venue_parking_detail: Parking off of D Street. Price range varies from $5.00 to $10.00.
fields.venue_general_rule: No outside food or alcohol allowed. Must be 21 or over to drink.

fields.venue_name: Paradise Rock Club presented by Citizens
fields.venue_accessible_seating: Tickets for this event are all general admission standing room only. Patrons requesting accessible seating should purchase a general admission ticket and you will be accommodated at the venue. Please contact information@crossroadspresents.com or call 617-562-8801 for questions or to make advance arrangements.

fields.venue_parking_detail: Parking is available at nearby garages underneath the Prudential Center on Boylston Street and on Dalton Street next to the Back Bay Hilton. Alternatively, metered spaces are located on surrounding streets. Sorry, we do not validate for parking however the Prudential Center often gives a discount to BPC ticket holders.
fields.venue_accessible_seating: Tickets for patrons requiring accessible seating are available for purchase by phone 617.747.2409 or in person at the Box Office. In an effort to accommodate as many patrons as possible in accessible sections, we limit each order to one accessible seat and one companion seat. Purchase of additional adjacent seats may be permitted, based on availability. Accessible restrooms are located on the first floor of the main lobby. Water fountains are located in the same lobby next to the restrooms.
fields.venue_general_rule: - No food or beverages permitted in the theater. - No alcohol, snacks, and drinks available. - Doors open approximately Â½ hour before show time. - All bags and carry in items are subject to search. Bag check at front doors. Large items discouraged. - No coat check available. - The following are not permitted in the theater: o Smoking o Photography o Audio/Video Recording

fields.venue_parking_detail: Location : Parking Garage At New England Medical Center Located Next To The Theatre On Tremont Street. Parking Also At City Place Parking On Charles Street @ The Transportation Building-Follow Stuart Street To Charles Street, The Garage Will Be On The Right. Transportation: Orange Line To N.E. Medical Center. Green Line To Boylston Street.
fields.venue_general_rule: General Rules Bags and backpacks are allowed but subject to search upon entry. No Recording No Cameras No Food/Drinks

fields.venue_parking_detail: The Xfinity Center facility contains 16 parking lots providing ample parking for all ticket holders with no additional charge. Be assured that every effort is made to ensure a safe and speedy exit from the facility. ALL RECREATIONAL VEHICLES AND BUSSES MUST BE FILLED TO CAPACITY WITH PATRONS HOLDING VALID TICKETS. NO TRAILERS, COMMERCIAL TRUCKS, OR COMMERCIAL CATERING BUSINESSES ARE ALLOWED IN THE PARKING LOTS.
fields.venue_general_rule: Lawn chairs are not allowed. No tapes or laser pointers. No Weapons. Xfinity Center allows food in provided it fits into a one gallon bag (Soft Coolers Only!). One bag per person. Xfinity Center allowed one factory sealed bottle of water per person. There is no smoking in the reserved seating areas of the Xfinity Center. Camera Policy: Personal cameras are allowed in the venue. Flash photography, video and removable lens cameras are not permitted without venue approval. In order to provide the safest and most enjoyable experience for our guests, as well as to expedite the screening process for everyone, effective Aug 1, 2016 the Xfinity Center will no longer allow bags to enter the venue. The only exceptions to this rule are the following: � A clear plastic or vinyl bag measuring no more than 12�x12�x6� � A small clutch approximately the size of a hand, with or without a strap � 1 gallon clear plastic bag with for food � An exception will also be made for medically necessary items after proper inspection

fields.venue_parking_detail: DCU Center parking garage (86 Central St., Worcester, MA 01608) is located at the corner of Major Taylor Blvd.(formerly Worcester Center Blvd.) and East Central St. The garage may be reached at (508)792-0314. Overnight parking is prohibited at the DCU Center's Parking Garage. Various garages and open air lots are close to venue. Prices range from $1.00 to $20.00.
fields.venue_general_rule: The following items are prohibited: Cameras Backpacks, knapsacks, coolers, suitcases, oversized handbags, and all other bags larger than 8" X 11" Recording Devices Laser pointers Food and Beverage Bottles and Cans Banners and Signs Umbrellas Weapons, Drugs, or other items considered contraband In accordance with state laws, the DCU Center has a No Smoking policy.

fields.venue_parking_detail: Adjacent to the Tsongas Center at UMass Lowell is the Ayotte Parking Garage. It and other designated lots are available for event parking.
fields.venue_general_rule: Rules and Restrictions: There is no re-entry. Video cameras are not permitted. There is no alcohol sold at college hockey games and there is no smoking allowed.

fields.venue_parking_detail: There is no general parking available on-site. Many private parking garages and lots can be found in the downtown area within walking distance of the arena. Metered on-street parking is available in the vicinity of the arena - please obey posted parking restrictions. Limited ADA parking is available on-site, accessed off Elm Street via Cedar Street in the southwest corner of the arena property. On-street ADA parking is also available on Chestnut Street at the rear of the arena. ADA spaces are designated for vehicles displaying a current state-issued disability placard or license plate.
fields.venue_accessible_seating: This is an accessible venue, accessible seating is available for purchase via Ticketmaster. To view current available inventory, please visit the Ticketmaster.com purchase page for your desired event.
fields.venue_general_rule: No outside food or beverage permitted. No professional cameras, video/sound recording equipment, backpacks, large bags, laser pointers or oversized signs permitted. No smoking is permitted within the building. No smoking is permitted within the building and no smoking area is provided. Shirts and shoes must be worn at all times.

fields.venue_name: Great Cedar Showroom at Foxwoods Resort Casino
fields.venue_general_rule: Items NOT alllowed : No signs smoking is NOT permitted

fields.venue_parking_detail: NO THEATRE PARKING LOT. LIMITED AMOUNT OF METERED PARKING (FREE AFTER 8:00PM) IN THE AREA.
fields.venue_general_rule: NO SMOKING. NO ALCOHOL. OTHER RULES MAY VARY.

fields.venue_name: Cross Insurance Arena (Formerly Cumberland County Civic Center)
fields.venue_parking_detail: Attached parking garage to the facility. Also, ground parking located all around the facility. All charge for parking, various rates.
fields.venue_accessible_seating: Accessible Seating is available at the box office and thru Ticketmaster.
fields.venue_general_rule: Cumberland County has announced new screening and hygiene protocols to prevent the spread of COVID-19 at events held at the Cross Insurance Arena. The new rules align the Arena with state and local recommendations, as well as guidance from the Federal CDC regarding protection against spreading COVID-19 in contained spaces. Effective October 22, attendees of events at the arena age 12 and over will need to provide evidence of vaccination against COVID-19, or a recent negative test taken within 72 hours of the event. Mask wearing is strongly recommended inside the Arena. Attendees who are too young to be vaccinated must wear a mask while attending events inside the Arena but do not need to provide a negative COVID-19 test. The new protocols will remain in place until further notice, but are likely to change based on the severity of the pandemic in Cumberland County and as vaccination becomes available for more age groups.

fields.venue_parking_detail: Opening and price varies per event. Please check www.gillettestadium.com for more information.
fields.venue_accessible_seating: Accessible Seating available through Ticketmaster and the box office.
fields.venue_general_rule: No umbrellas, coolers, cans, bottles or alcohol allowed in stadium. Tailgating, picnicing, BBQ's allowed in specific areas of parking lots. No open fires. Gillette has a new Clear Bag Policy! Bags of any kind will not be permitted except for gallon size clear freezer or authorized clear bags measuring 12"x 12" x 6" and women's clutches not to exceed 7" x 4" x 2" (approximately the size of a hand). For more information visit: WWW.GILLETTESTADIUM.COM/BAGPOLICY

fields.venue_parking_detail: For detailed information about parking at MGM Springfield, please visit https://www.mgmspringfield.com/en/amenities/parking-and-transportation.html
fields.venue_accessible_seating: Accessible Seating is available for one (1) accessible seat and one (1) companion seat only. Any other arrangements must be made through the Box Office. Accessible entrance located on East Columbus Ave. side of Symphony Hall.
fields.venue_general_rule: Smoking in designated areas only, this includes vaping and e-cigarettes, no audio recorders, no flash photography, and no outside food.

fields.venue_name: Capitol Center for the Arts - NH

fields.venue_parking_detail: Agganis Arena has 2 level of parking beneath the building, as well as 1 surface lot behind the building. Parking is also available in: Lot D - 25 Buick Street Lot F - 808 Commonwealth Avenue
fields.venue_accessible_seating: Agganis Arena fully complies and exceeds all requirements as set forth in the American Disabilities Act. If you require accessible seating while at an event, please visit Guest Services located on the concourse near section 101. The Arena offers accessible and companion seating located on the Concourse and Event levels for all events. (Accessible seating locations are subject to change based on the seating configuration for various events)
fields.venue_general_rule: No Smoking allowed in the building. There is not a smokers area on site.

fields.venue_parking_detail: Numerous garage and lot spaces available. All parking is free. Valet parking also available.
fields.venue_accessible_seating: The Mohegan Sun is an accessible venue for patrons in wheelchairs. They may be purchased at the Box Office, over the phones, or at Ticketmaster retail locations and online.
fields.venue_general_rule: Smoking is only allowed in designated outside areas. No re-entry permitted. Customers will be subject to search and seizure upon arrival. Additional house rules may apply.

fields.venue_name: Brighton Music Hall presented by Citizens
fields.venue_parking_detail: Limited street parking is available, and parking vouchers for the parking lot located at 181 Brighton Ave may be purchased on Ticketmaster if you also purchase a ticket for the corresponding night’s show at Brighton Music Hall. A parking attendant will scan your paper or mobile phone parking voucher. You will not be admitted to the lot if you do not provide a valid voucher. You may park your vehicle in a spot at the far left side of the lot as directed by the parking attendant from 1 hour before show until 1 hour after the Brighton Music Hall show ends or 2:30am, whichever comes first. Your vehicle is subject to towing after this time. Neither Brighton Music Hall nor Hallston Realty Associates are responsible and neither assumes liability for any loss or damage to your vehicle or items left in your vehicle, whether resulting from fire, theft or other cause. Tailgating is not permitted on the lot.
fields.venue_accessible_seating: Tickets for this event are all general admission standing room only. Patrons requesting accessible seating should purchase a general admission ticket and you will be accommodated at the venue. Please contact information@crossroadspresents.com or call 617-562-8801 for questions or to make advance arrangements.

fields.venue_parking_detail: All parking is on site. General parking is included in the price of your ticket. Premier parking is located in the lot closest to the main entrance of the facility for an additional charge and may be purchased in advance at all points of sale. Premier parking may also be purchased just prior to show time at the entrance to the lot. Sales are cash only and are subject to availability. Parking for the disabled is located in the spaces directly in front of the theater for no additional charge and is available to patrons who possess a handicapped parking sticker, hang tag or license plate.
fields.venue_accessible_seating: Theater and all facilities are fully ADA accessible. Elevator access to all levels of the facility. Special seating is available for patrons with mobility impairments, visual impairments and hearing impairments. Infra-red hearing devices are available for all shows free of charge (ID required) at the Administrative offices.
fields.venue_general_rule: There is no dress code however shirts and shoes are required. This is a non-smoking facility. A smoking area is located outside of the lobby for attendees. Camera Policy: Personal cameras are allowed in the venue. Flash photography, video and removable lens cameras are not permitted without venue approval. No laser pointers, weapons, large bags. No outside food or beverages are permitted into the facility. Concessions : The theater offers a variety of concessions items. Traditional fare is available at our concessions stands. A full bar is offered as well as beer and wine for adults 21 years and older. Picture ID is required for the purchase of alcoholic beverages. Concessions items are cash only.

fields.venue_accessible_seating: Venue is wheelchair accessible. Please note it is unlawful for anyone, other than those with a disability or that guest's companion, to use tickets for disabled seating locations (unless such areas have been released for general seating). ** It is encouraged that guests who require accessible accommodations arrive 30 minutes prior to doors opening** Call Box Office for tickets or more information.
fields.venue_general_rule: No bottles, cans, outside food or beverages (including alcohol), any item that can be used as a weapon. No dress code for concerts. ALL SALES ARE FINAL. NO REFUNDS OR EXCHANGES. Camera Policy: Personal cameras are allowed in the venue. Flash photography, video and removable lens cameras are not permitted without venue approval. Lighters are not allowed in the venue and there is absolutely NO SMOKING OR VAPING allowed at the venue per the city of Boston Ordinances. Any smoking or vaping will result in IMMEDIATE EJECTION from the event. All bags larger than 10 in x 9 in, backpacks, professional cameras (i.e detachable lenses), video equipment, luggage, and like articles are strictly prohibited. Please make sure necessary arrangements are made ahead of time as these items are not allowed on the premise. All patrons subject to search upon venue entry. Any medication must be accompanied with proof of prescription. Other prohibited items: drug paraphernalia, weapons, knives, liquid containers, selfie sticks, tablets, laptops, outside food or drinks, any gang affiliated apparel or accessories including bandanas, laser pointers, glass, any LED apparel, candy or beaded jewelry, masks, glow sticks, toys, furry boots, etc.
